alert.note: Alert for Cherokee; Craig; Mayes; Muskogee; Okmulgee; Rogers; Wagoner (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 23 at 11:31PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Craig, southeastern Rogers, Mayes, Wagoner, northwestern Cherokee, northeastern Okmulgee and northwestern Muskogee Counties through 1215 AM CDT... At 1130 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 5 miles northeast of Tiawah to 3 miles southeast of Coweta to near Bald Hill. Movement was northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations in or near the path include... Muskogee... Claremore... Wagoner... Pryor... Coweta... Pryor Creek... Chouteau... Haskell... Inola... Locust Grove... Salina... Langley... Adair... Okay... Porter... Ketchum... Spavinaw... Disney... Big Cabin... Taft... This includes Interstate 44 between mile markers 247 and 276. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until midnight CDT for northeastern Oklahoma.

area.areaDesc: Cherokee; Craig; Mayes; Muskogee; Okmulgee; Rogers; Wagoner
